description: {"blocks":[{"key":"cjpee","text":"This is a modified transfer buffer recipe for a semi-dry Western blot.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Basic aspects of protein blotting. In Protein Blotting: Methodology, Research and Diagnostic Applications, B.A. Baldo et al., eds. (Basel, Switzerland: Karger), pp. 5–41.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ccpsb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7vbd9","text":"Towbin H et al. ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"b9c2i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"62hsf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"DF3C0B00074711ED8FC49D3811F78E2D","id":0,"label":"working solution","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"EF8DE640074711ED8FC49D3811F78E2D","id":0,"label":"10x stock buffer","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"150","error":false,"guid":"FE142940074711ED8FC49D3811F78E2D","id":0,"label":"Isopropanol","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"22F2A340074811ED8FC49D3811F78E2D","id":0,"label":"with original recipe, the working buffer uses 20% ethanol, but here we changed it to 15% isopropanol.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7a7ub","text":"Tips (modified from Bio-Rad: https://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/Bulletin_6211.pdf):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"bold","offset":101,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":72}],"data":{}},{"key":"91pkk","text":"1. Use high-quality, analytical grade reagents to enable better buffer conductivity and hence better transfer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e64kd","text":"2. If reusing the buffer, measure the pH before use and make sure it maintains at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":82,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"aejdn","text":"3. Do not further dilute the transfer buffer from 1x to the levels below the recommended concentration, because this decreases the buffering capacity of the buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"918m5","text":"4. Do not adjust the pH of the buffer, because it can result in increased buffer conductivity, manifested by higher initial current output and decreased resistance.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9b0ic","text":"5. There is no SDS in this recipe, but it can be added when it is necessary. Increasing SDS in the transfer buffer increases protein transfer from the gel but decreases the binding of the protein to the nitrocellulose membrane. In this case, nitrocellulose membrane can be substituted by PVDF membrane when SDS is used in the transfer buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63ukm","text":"6. Addition of SDS increases the relative current, power, and heating during transfer, and may also affect the antigenicity of some proteins.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1j8a","text":"7. Increasing alcohol in the transfer buffer decreases protein transfer from the gel and increases the binding of the protein to the nitrocellulose membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BA3145B0075D11EDB1D00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.bio-rad.com/webroot/web/pdf/lsr/literature/Bulletin_6211.pdf"}},"1":{"type":"ph","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"38CA9BD0074A11ED8FC49D3811F78E2D","id":0,"number":"9.2"}}}}
